comment: a(0) could be considered to be 0 if the binary representation of zero were chosen to be the empty string. - _Jason Kimberley_, Sep 19 2011
link: T. D. Noe and Indranil Ghosh, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (first 1024 terms from T. D. Noe)
mathematica: dtn[ L_ ] := Fold[ 2#1+#2&, 0, L ]; f[ n_ ] := dtn[ Reverse[ 1-IntegerDigits[ n, 2 ] ] ]; Table[ f[ n ], {n, 0, 100} ]
program: a036044 n = foldl (\v d -> 2 * v + d) 0 (unfoldr bc n) where
bc x = Just (1 - m, x') where (x',m) = divMod x 2
(MAGMA) A036044:=func<n|n eq 0 select 1 else SequenceToInteger(Reverse([1-b:b in IntegerToSequence(n,2)]),2)>; // _Jason Kimberley_, Sep 19 2011
